intro: Veyretia sincorensis, commonly known as the Congo violet, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
